New Records: Lane Thomas hit his first home run as a Cleveland Guardian with a two-run blast in the fifth inning.
Josh Naylor hit a two-run home run in the sixth inning, giving him his 29th home run and 100 RBI for the season.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas and Josh Naylor provided the Guardians with all the offense they needed with their two-run home runs.
Gavin Williams allowed a run in the second inning but settled in after a talk with his pitching coach, completing seven strong innings.
Jhonkensy Noel made a diving catch in the eighth inning to prevent the Royals from scoring, which was a crucial moment in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised Lane Thomas's performance and the bullpen's effectiveness.
Gavin Williams credited his pitching adjustment for the win after allowing runs early in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians moved to 28-33 overall since June 26 and were 21-22 since the All-Star Break.
Cleveland has a magic number of 22 to clinch the division with 24 games left.
